title: Galician Workers' Front
text:
Galician Workers' Front (FOGA, "Fronte Obreira Galega" in <a href="Galician%20language">Galician language</a>) is a <a href="Galiza">Galician</a> political organization. It was formed in 2010 by militants of the trade union world, mainly of the <a href="Confederaci%C3%B3n%20Intersindical%20Galega">Confederación Intersindical Galega</a> (CIG). The organization was integrated in the <a href="Galician%20Nationalist%20Bloc">Galician Nationalist Bloc</a> (BNG) until 2012, when the FOGA abandoned the <a href="Galician%20Nationalist%20Bloc">BNG</a> and was one of the three parties that formed <a href="Renewal%E2%80%93Nationalist%20Brotherhood">Renewal–Nationalist Brotherhood</a>.
History.
FOGA had an MP in the <a href="Galician%20Parliament">Galician Parliament</a>, Chelo Martínez, between 2012 and 2014. Its top leaders are Miguel Anxo Malvido, its national coordinator, and Tino Álvarez, the national spokesperson. in 2014 Chelo Martínez left FOGA and joined <a href="Cerna%20%28political%20organization%29">Cerna</a>.
FOGA left Anova in 2014. Since then, FOGA has become closer to the <a href="Galician%20Nationalist%20Bloc">Galician Nationalist Bloc</a> (BNG) again
FOGA supported <a href="We%E2%80%93Galician%20Candidacy">We–Galician Candidacy</a> in the <a href="2015%20Spanish%20general%20election">2015 Spanish general election</a>. In the <a href="2016%20Spanish%20general%20election">2016 Spanish general election</a> FOGA supported the <a href="Galician%20Nationalist%20Bloc">BNG</a> again. in January 2017 FOGA rejoined the <a href="Galician%20Nationalist%20Bloc">BNG</a>.
